title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 June 2016 - XWiki

08:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:04 <abusenius> has quit  
09:15 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: hi, you were mentioning a String to Properties converter, do you know where it is?  
09:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's part of beanutils AFAIK  
09:26 <tmortagne> it does not work ?  
09:26 <tmortagne> I never used it myself so I may have been wrong  
09:26 <vmassol> checking my depedency:tree  
09:27 <vmassol> I do have beanutils and it's not found  
09:27 <vmassol> by our commons properties converter  
09:27 <vmassol> Caused by: org.xwiki.properties.converter.ConversionException: Failed to find a Converter to convert from [java.lang.String] to [java.util.Properties]  
09:27 <tmortagne> ok then I mixed with something else, anyway should be easy to implement but if you are in an extension it won't help you  
09:28 <vmassol> BTW I've done a quick impl of my converter yetserday  
09:28 <vmassol> what I'm talking about here is for another need  
09:28 <tmortagne> ok  
09:29 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/jira/blob/973d38d4562a0f075a0171e42a0e6fc844fdf5f1/jira-macro/jira-macro-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/jira/macro/internal/FieldParser.java  
09:29 <vmassol> but it's hard to make something generic out of it  
09:29 <vmassol> actually  
09:30 <vmassol> I should probably have used parboiled but I need to get more familiar with it  
09:30 <vmassol> it's a nice tool for creating parsers  
09:31 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol> I tihnk I can use the List Converter first and then parse each list entry  
09:35 <vmassol> (for the Properties use case)  
09:35 <tmortagne> it won't be the same syntax  
09:35 <vmassol> my need is:  
09:35 <vmassol> a=b,c=d  
09:35 <vmassol> hmm no  
09:35 <tmortagne> then Properties parser won't cover that  
09:35 <vmassol> it won't work  
09:35 <vmassol> yes I know  
09:36 <vmassol> hmm it could  
09:36 <vmassol> was thinking about quotes but we don't need them around a or b  
09:36 <tmortagne> is it for a macro parameter ?  
09:36 <vmassol> "some key = some value", c=d  
09:36 <vmassol> should work  
09:37 <vmassol> it's for a generic 'parameters" macro parameter yes  
09:37 <vmassol> otherwise I can just reuse the custom parser I coded yesterday  
09:38 <vmassol> it's very similar  
09:38 <tmortagne> it would be weird to have a List type for a parameter which is supported to be a map, I think you should either user String and parse it yourself or find a map like type for it  
09:38 <vmassol> actually I'm just using a string ATM  
09:38 <vmassol> the parsing is done in the macro  
09:38 <tmortagne> ok then you don't need converter  
09:39 <vmassol> well  
09:39 <vmassol> for yesteday's need it was too hard to define a structure  
09:39 <vmassol> not very hard but unnecessarily complex  
09:39 <vmassol> now for this use case  
09:39 <vmassol> it's more generic  
09:39 <tmortagne> yes looks generic  
09:39 <vmassol> so we could imagine a generic parser thay could be contriuted back  
09:39 <vmassol> for others to use too  
09:40 <tmortagne> yes  
09:40 <tmortagne> especially since we do have the need to already in others macros I think  
09:40 <vmassol> ah? you have one in mind?.  
09:40 <vmassol> I was looking for such an example  
09:40 <tmortagne> I think I remember some macro taking a map and doing the parsing internally  
09:40 <tmortagne> don't remember which one, would have to search  
09:41 <tmortagne> (not a macro I did)  
09:41 <Pbas> Hi, You can not use jsontools? http://maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/xwiki-javadoc-4.1.x/org/xwiki/velocity/tools/JSONTool.html#JSONTool%28%29  
09:41 <vmassol> I can search for map in \*PArameters classes  
09:41 <tmortagne> you don't find it because map is not supported  
09:41 <tmortagne> it will be a String parsed by the macro  
09:41 <vmassol> right and the parsing is probably done in the macro impl class  
09:41 <vmassol> and passed as a string  
09:41 <tmortagne> yes  
09:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: doesn't chart macro have a parameter like this ?  
09:42 <vmassol> it's a different format but yes  
09:43 <tmortagne> I see params which is "Additional parameters for the data source"  
09:43 <vmassol> a:b,c:d  
09:43 <vmassol> I think  
09:43 <tmortagne> I think that's the one I remember  
09:43 <vmassol> so similar  
09:43 <vmassol> checking  
09:43 <tmortagne> but maybe it's not marsed by the macro itself but b the lib it's using  
09:43 <tmortagne> s/marsed/parsed/  
09:43 <vmassol> we do parse it  
09:44 <tmortagne> indeed  
09:44 <tmortagne> so that's another need  
09:44 <vmassol> format is:  
09:44 <vmassol> a:b;c:d  
09:44 <vmassol> very simple parsing  
09:44 <tmortagne> but a theorical need because we can't really change the syntax of this macro parameter now  
09:44 <vmassol> not supporting quotes  
09:44 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/ee06a667263747eb8e4741b926b4ec23653acf73/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-chart/xwiki-platform-chart-macro/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/macro/chart/ChartMacro.java#L205-L205  
09:46 <mflorea> has quit  
09:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <vmassol> on a different topic I think we need to use the {{cache}} macro for all extensions pages with release notes  
09:48 <vmassol> (and stop displaying all release notes)  
09:48 <tmortagne> I don't think we need cache macro but we should load the release note asynchronously and have pagination probably  
09:49 <vmassol> another idea is for the jira macro to be async but it would be nice to add generic supoprt for async macro  
09:49 <vmassol> s/would be nice/would be nicer  
09:49 <vmassol> I know you had a jira issue on this  
09:49 <tmortagne> yes but no time to work on it  
09:49 <vmassol> e.x.o is really slow for pages with release notes  
09:50 <vmassol> this one is taking real long for me: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration  
09:50 <vmassol> like 5-6 seconds  
09:51 <tmortagne> what should be async is maybe the jira macro actually  
09:51 <tmortagne> there is not much RN on this extension  
09:51 <vmassol> yes thre are worse but even that is already slowing down a lot  
09:52 <vmassol> \*there are worse ones  
09:52 <vmassol> yes the jira macro should be async  
09:52 <vmassol> but it would be nicer if we had generic async support for macros instead of coding is specifically just for the jira maro  
09:52 <vmassol> \*macro  
09:53 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <vmassol> TBH I was hesitating coding it for the jira macro since I'm on it but have refrained so far… ;)  
09:54 <tmortagne> sure a generic macro would be nice but I think jira macro should probably always be async  
09:54 <vmassol> yes but you would do the work twice  
09:54 <vmassol> once for making the jira macro async and oncre more to have a generic mechanism  
09:55 <tmortagne> it's not exactly the same work  
09:55 <vmassol> I'm not sure it's very different  
09:55 <vmassol> basically you execute the macro rendering in a thread and you have some js to inject the result in HTML  
09:55 <tmortagne> making jira macro async is about displaying a json coming directly from jira server while generic async macro is about rendering asynchronously a wiki content  
09:56 <vmassol> (which btw can causes issues for our exporters if htey don't support js)  
09:57 <vmassol> its not really possible to rewrite the jira macro to execute in js  
09:57 <vmassol> (if that's what you mean)  
10:00 <tmortagne> it would be more or less about making jira macro use livetable and have the custom livetable source convert jira json into xwiki livetable json  
10:00 <tmortagne> but yes it's a very different implementation  
10:01 <tmortagne> but most of the work is in writing a custom jira livetable source  
10:02 <vmassol> actually I was thinking about adding livetable support as a source  
10:02 <vmassol> err  
10:02 <vmassol> not source  
10:02 <vmassol> displayer  
10:02 <vmassol> right now we have 3: enum, list, table  
10:03 <vmassol> I was contemplating adding a 4th one: livetable  
10:03 <vmassol> :)  
10:03 <vmassol> but it's a bit different than async support  
10:03 <vmassol> which you could want even for the other displayers  
10:04 <tmortagne> well it does give you async so that's a start
